reviews.review_msg: Salta was kind and tried her best to engage the class. However, the lectures were quite heavy and she did not make the class a comfortable place to participate in despite her efforts. The grading for papers was lenient but the midterm and exam were VERY difficult so beware. She is a nice person overall though.

I really enjoyed this class on Migration, Identity, and Citizenship and learned a ton. I believe this was her first time teaching at SFU and I'm very impressed by how smooth it all went. Lectures were well organized and interesting, readings were pretty short (1-1.5h a week), and marking was on the easier side. Nothing but good things to say
